Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Diallo would face unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship if required to apply for permanent residence from Guinea
Procedural_Stage: Judicial Review of H&C Application Decision
Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistencies in application; lack of personalized risk evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove unusual hardship
Legal_Rule: Applicant must prove personal circumstances causing unusual hardship not anticipated by the Immigration Act
Procedural_Issue: PRRA officer review followed by judicial review application
Grounds_for_Claim: Hardship due to conditions in Guinea and establishment in Canada
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer exercised discretion with sufficient reasoning
Key_Evidence_Considered: Conditions in Guinea, applicant's establishment in Canada, inconsistencies in testimony
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds provisions under IRPA
Defendant_Response: Officer concluded no exceptional hardship based on evidence
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal claims, country condition reports
Remedy_Requested: Permanent residence in Canada on H&C grounds
Remedy_Sought: Avoid removal to Guinea and obtain permanent resident status
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: None specified; based on failed refugee claim
Applicable_Process: H&C application process followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Regulatory and policy framework for H&C applications
